revised_title: The Development of Branchial Arterial Arches in Birds: A Reevaluation of Rathke's Theories
tldr: The author investigates the development of the branchial arterial arches in birds, specifically the origin of the subclavian and carotid arteries. Contrary to Rathke's theories, the author finds that the subclavian artery arises from the ventral end of the third arch, while the common carotid artery is formed from the truncus arteriosus. This challenges the widely accepted understanding of the development of these arteries in birds and other vertebrates.
